722053f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 35th Street
722053f-a.text:
Fark Avenue, east side, at 35th Street, showing the two apartment
houses on the S.E. corner built from 1923 to 1926, and the old
Ro65 mansion on the N.E. corner, which has housed the Advertising
Club since late 1922.
In the foreground may be seen the excavation left by the Community
Church at the N.w. corner of 34th Street, and on the horizon the
new Daily News Suilding on 42nd Street east of Third Avenue.
April 15, 1931.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

722060f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 35th Street
722060f-a.text:
Park Avenue, west side, from 35th Street, to a point between
36th and 37th Streets.
On the N. W. corner of 35th Street, where the old Church
of the Covenant stood from 1865 to 1895, is hhown the house
occupied by the Women's City Club. Behind it towers the new
building at 10 East 40th Street.
March 10, 1929
P. L. Sperr
NO REERODUCTIONS
(2)
A portion of the formmer view at a slightly later date.
Note the vacant lot at No. 30. This site was utilized for a wing
to hhe adjoining structure.
The dominant No. 10 East 40th Street Building (erected 1928)
partly obscures the newer No. 500-Fifth Avenue Building. To the
right ap.ears the southerly side of the recently constructed
IInion League Club. This building is at the S. W. corner of
Park Avenue and East 37th Street and was erected in 1930.
Neg S0  February 23, 1931
0/ --
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(3)
Details of the demolition of the Women's Club and its
isomorphic structnre, No. 28 Park Avenue, the pronerty of
F. F. Guthrie. Upon this site will rise a tall apartmemt
building. The five-story affair at the left will not be
included. This bears No. 39 East 35th Street and is occupied
by the United Lutheran Church of America.
October, 1938
George D. Chinn
NO REPRODUCTIONS

712274f-b.title: Manhattan: 35th Street - Avenue R
712274f-b.text:
(1)
35th Street, east of the Hudson River, showing the New York
Central Railroad.
May 30, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(.)
The same, several years aakber.
April ss, 1931.
P. L. Seerr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712274f-a.text:

722057f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 35th Street
722057f-a.text:
Fark Avenue, west side, from 35th to 37th Streets, showing part of
the Women's City Club on the N.W. corner of 35th Street and a
vacant lot at 30 Park Avenue left by demolition of an old 5-story
house.
On the S.W. corner of 37th Street is shown the new clubhouse of the
Union League Club, shortly after completion.
February 27, 1931.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

722054f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 35th Street (East)
722054f-a.text:
Park Avenue, at the N. W. corner of East 35th Street,
showing the Church of the Covnant. At the left is an
extensive view westward to Madison Avenue. At the N. E.
corner there is the Church of the Incarnation. Note the
absence of the spire atop same. This feature was added
in 1892 after a period of 30 years.
Prior to 1892
Gift of Urbrock Collection
MAY BE REPRODUCED

722052f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 35th Street
722052f-a.text:
(1)
Park Ave., east side, north from 35th Street, showing the old
Robb mansion, occupied since 1922 by the Advertising Club, on the N.E.
corner of 35th Street. At the S.E. corner of 37th Street may be noted
the 9-story apartment built in 1923 on the site of the old Judge
Russell house, and behind it, on the horizon, the towering Chanin
Building recently erected at Lexington Ave. and 42nd Street. In the
left background may be seen the Grand Central Station and the New
York Central Building (1928) beyond it.
March 27, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, exclusive of the N.E. corner of East 35th Street.
Pebruary 19, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
According to the New Lork Times of October 18, 1937, No. 29
Park Ave. (third building from right in No. 2) has been purchased by
the Association for the Improvement of the Poor (A.I.C.P.) and will
be utilined as a dental climic to replace the present clinic on the
N.E. corner of Lexington Ave. and East 22nd Street,which will be
demolished for an addition to the Childrens Court. No. 29, was
erected in 1908 by Mrs. A. Murray Young, as a copy of a London
Residence.

730416f-a.title: General view - [Manhattan - Park Avenue - 35th Street (Northwest).]
730416f-a.text:
A general view, northwest from 17 Park Ave., south from 35th Street,
showing the Chanin Building (at the left) and the Chrysler Building
(at the right) in the background.
February 27, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

722056f.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 35th Street (East)
722056f.text:
Park Ave., west side, north from and including Sast 35th., to, but
not including East 36th Strcets. Also shown is East 35th Street, north
side, west from Park, to Madison AvOs. The Church of the Covenant is
on Park Ave., at the N.i. corner of East 35th Street. On the same block
but at the N.E. corner of Madison Ave., is the Protestant Efpiscopal Church
of theIncarnation.
Prddor to1890.
Eugene L. Armbruster, Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

722049f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 35th Street (East)
722049f-a.text:
Park Avenue, south from East 35th Street, showing
prominently the towered 71st Regiment Armory at the
S. E. corner of 34th Street. Note at the right the
construction details of the Fred F. French constructed
apartment house, No. 16 Park Aenue. Adjoinfng same
is the Community Church at 34th Street. View 2 is thru
the church clearance, where the apartment house, No. 10
Park Awenue is being erected. The utilitarian structure
in the background is the well known No. 1 Park A enue
uilding. See newspaper files for litigation between
this corporation and Mrs. Bacon who sought to retain
thts Rddress for her Swiss Chalet residence at the N. W.
corner of 34th Street. A view of the lattar is obstructed
by the lamppost tn the earlier photo.
View 1: January 1924
Nugene L. Armbruster
MAY 8E REPRODUCED
View 2: April 15, 1931
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUUCTIONS

722055f.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 35th Street
722055f.text:
Park Ave., no. 23 at 35h St.
Ne home of Advertising Llub of New York.
Photographer: H. Shobbrook Collins, W. 22nd St., N.Y.

722051f.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 35th Street
722051f.text:
Park Avenue, at the N. W. corner of 35th Street, showing
the Church of the Covenant. This church, built for the Biberal
Presbyterian denomination, was dedicated in 18b5, and stood here
until demolition(about 18951. The site was then occupied by three
small residences, Nos. 26, 28, and 32 Park Avenue. The conner
house No. 2o, will later be occupied by the Women's City Club
and which in 1939 will be replaced with a modern apartment house.
Note the fence around the center parks; it is probably the
oririnal fence of the 1860's and will remain as it is till 1923.
TTo the left, on Madison Avenue apoears the steepleless Church of
the Incarnation.
